thread.title: Nicki Minaj's reply to Remy Ma's seven-minute diss track | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Nicki Minaj's reply to Remy Ma's seven-minute diss track | Daily Mail Online

author: Leeor Samocha For Dailymail.Com
title: Nicki Minaj's reply to Remy Ma's seven-minute diss track | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share 'Oooohhh, oh you the qu-e-e-the queen of this here?/One platinum plaque, album flopped, b***h, where?/Hahaha, a /I took two bars off just to laugh. 'You see, silly rabbit, to be the queen of rap/You gotta sell records, you gotta get plaques/S, plural like the S on my chest.' Unbothered: Nicki Minaj released a collaboration with rapper Gucci Mane titled Make Love. Internet speculation grew on Friday that the song was aimed at Remy Ma Pretty clear: Remy, birth name Reminisce Smith, was not as subtle on ShETHER Remy, birth name Reminisce Smith, was not as subtle on ShETHER, which she released on Soundcloud . Her song, which is a play on Ether, the famous 2001 diss track by Nas against Bey's husband Jay Z, clearly began with a repetition of 'F***k Nicki Minaj.' Remy dragged her foe's ex Meek Mill into the mess, spitting: 'And I saw Meek at [NBA] All-Star [Game], he told me your a** dropped/He couldn't f*** you for three months because your a** dropped/Now I don't think y'all understand how bad her a** got/The implants that she had put in her a** popped.' She also named Drake - Nicki's longtime friend - and called the Anaconda singer an 'A-list groupie.' Coming out swingin': Her song, which is a play on Ether, the famous 2001 diss track by Nas against Bey's husband Jay Z, clearly began with a repetition of 'F***k Nicki Minaj'' 'Yikes': Nicki also posted a screenshot of the underwhelming sales figures for Remy's joint album with Fat Joe titled Plata O Plomo Nicki's answer to the Remy's low blows was to pull out a magic card: cite Beyonce, who knighted Nicki the queen of rap in 2015. Taking to Instagram - where she boasts 74.6million followers - Minaj posted a video of herself and Queen Bey as her song 'Nicki's Track' played in the background. 'I met this girl named Nicki, I guess you could say she was the rap queen.' Friends in high places! Nicki's answer to the Remy's low blows was to pull out a magic card: cite Beyonce, who knighted Nicki the queen of rap in 2015. Nicki also posted a screenshot of the underwhelming sales figures for Remy's joint album with Fat Joe titled Plata O Plomo. She captioned the post: 'Yikes.' Disagreements between the two women began in 2007, before Remy was jailed for six years after being found guilty of assault for shooting a friend during an argument at a party. While Remy was locked up, she stated that she was supportive of Nicki and her success, but added that she was going to be a 'problem' to Minaj once she was released. Remy was released from prison in 2014 after serving six years.
